trans-unit.source: Provision Apache Spark clusters in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Provision Apache Spark clusters in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to provision Spark clusters for Azure HDInsight by using the Azure portal, Azure PowerShell, a command line, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to provision Spark clusters for Azure HDInsight by using the Azure portal, Azure PowerShell, a command line, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: Provision Apache Spark clusters in HDInsight using custom options
trans-unit.target: Provision Apache Spark clusters in HDInsight using custom options

trans-unit.source: For most scenarios, you can provision a Spark cluster using the quick create method as described in <link><linkText>Get Started with Apache Spark on HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For most scenarios, you can provision a Spark cluster using the quick create method as described in <link><linkText>Get Started with Apache Spark on HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In certain scenarios, you might want to provision a customized cluster.
trans-unit.target: In certain scenarios, you might want to provision a customized cluster.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might want to attach an external metadata store to keep your Hive metadata persistent beyond the lifetime of a cluster, or you might want to use additional storage with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might want to attach an external metadata store to keep your Hive metadata persistent beyond the lifetime of a cluster, or you might want to use additional storage with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For such and other scenarios, this article provides instructions on how to use the Azure portal, Azure PowerShell, or the HDInsight .NET SDK to provision a customized Spark cluster on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: For such and other scenarios, this article provides instructions on how to use the Azure portal, Azure PowerShell, or the HDInsight .NET SDK to provision a customized Spark cluster on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: Before you begin the instructions in this article, you must have an Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Before you begin the instructions in this article, you must have an Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>What are the different configuration options?
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>What are the different configuration options?

trans-unit.source: Additional storage
trans-unit.target: Additional storage

trans-unit.source: During configuration, you must specify an Azure Blob storage account and a default container.
trans-unit.target: During configuration, you must specify an Azure Blob storage account and a default container.

trans-unit.source: This is used as the default storage location by the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This is used as the default storage location by the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you can specify an additional Azure Storage account that will also be associated with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you can specify an additional Azure Storage account that will also be associated with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Don't share one Blob storage container for multiple clusters.
trans-unit.target: Don't share one Blob storage container for multiple clusters.

trans-unit.source: This is not supported.
trans-unit.target: This is not supported.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using secondary Blob stores, see <link><linkText>Using Azure Blob Storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on using secondary Blob stores, see <link><linkText>Using Azure Blob Storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Metastore
trans-unit.target: Metastore

trans-unit.source: Spark enables you to define schema and Hive tables over raw data.
trans-unit.target: Spark enables you to define schema and Hive tables over raw data.

trans-unit.source: You can save these schemas and table metadata to external metastores.
trans-unit.target: You can save these schemas and table metadata to external metastores.

trans-unit.source: Using the metastore helps you to retain your Hive metadata, so that you don't need to re-create Hive tables when you provision a new cluster.
trans-unit.target: Using the metastore helps you to retain your Hive metadata, so that you don't need to re-create Hive tables when you provision a new cluster.

trans-unit.source: By default, Hive uses an embedded database to store this information.
trans-unit.target: By default, Hive uses an embedded database to store this information.

trans-unit.source: The embedded database can't preserve the metadata when the cluster is deleted.
trans-unit.target: The embedded database can't preserve the metadata when the cluster is deleted.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to create a SQL database in Azure, see <link><linkText>Create your first Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to create a SQL database in Azure, see <link><linkText>Create your first Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Cluster customization
trans-unit.target: Cluster customization

trans-unit.source: You can install additional components or customize cluster configuration by using scripts during provisioning.
trans-unit.target: You can install additional components or customize cluster configuration by using scripts during provisioning.

trans-unit.source: Such scripts are invoked via Script Action, which is a configuration option that can be used from the Azure portal, HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: Such scripts are invoked via Script Action, which is a configuration option that can be used from the Azure portal, HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action[hdinsight-customize-cluster]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action[hdinsight-customize-cluster]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Virtual networking
trans-unit.target: Virtual networking

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Azure Virtual Network</linkText><title></title></link> allows you to create a secure, persistent network containing the resources you need for your solution.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Azure Virtual Network</linkText><title></title></link> allows you to create a secure, persistent network containing the resources you need for your solution.

trans-unit.source: A virtual network allows you to:
trans-unit.target: A virtual network allows you to:

trans-unit.source: Connect cloud resources together in a private network (cloud-only).
trans-unit.target: Connect cloud resources together in a private network (cloud-only).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>diagram of cloud-only configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>diagram of cloud-only configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Connect your cloud resources to your local data-center network (site-to-site or point-to-site) by using a virtual private network (VPN).
trans-unit.target: Connect your cloud resources to your local data-center network (site-to-site or point-to-site) by using a virtual private network (VPN).

trans-unit.source: Site-to-site configuration allows you to connect multiple resources from your data center to the Azure virtual network by using a hardware VPN or the Routing and Remote Access Service.
trans-unit.target: Site-to-site configuration allows you to connect multiple resources from your data center to the Azure virtual network by using a hardware VPN or the Routing and Remote Access Service.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>diagram of site-to-site configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>diagram of site-to-site configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Point-to-site configuration allows you to connect a specific resource to the Azure virtual network by using a software VPN.
trans-unit.target: Point-to-site configuration allows you to connect a specific resource to the Azure virtual network by using a software VPN.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>diagram of point-to-site configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>diagram of point-to-site configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For more information on Virtual Network features, benefits, and capabilities, see the <link><linkText>Azure Virtual Network overview</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on Virtual Network features, benefits, and capabilities, see the <link><linkText>Azure Virtual Network overview</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You must create the Azure virtual network before provisioning a cluster.
trans-unit.target: You must create the Azure virtual network before provisioning a cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to create a Virtual Network</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to create a Virtual Network</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Azure HDInsight supports only location-based virtual networks and does not currently work with affinity group-based virtual networks.
trans-unit.target: Azure HDInsight supports only location-based virtual networks and does not currently work with affinity group-based virtual networks.

trans-unit.source: It is highly recommended to designate a single subnet for one cluster.
trans-unit.target: It is highly recommended to designate a single subnet for one cluster.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Using the Azure Preview Portal
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Using the Azure Preview Portal

trans-unit.source: Spark clusters on HDInsight use an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: Spark clusters on HDInsight use an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: An Azure Storage account located on the same data center is required before you can create an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Storage account located on the same data center is required before you can create an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob Storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob Storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For details on creating an Azure Storage account, see <link><linkText>How to Create a Storage Account[azure-create-storageaccount]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details on creating an Azure Storage account, see <link><linkText>How to Create a Storage Account[azure-create-storageaccount]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To create an HDInsight cluster by using the Custom Create option
trans-unit.target: To create an HDInsight cluster by using the Custom Create option

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure Preview Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure Preview Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click NEW, Click Data Analytics, and then click HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Click NEW, Click Data Analytics, and then click HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Creating a new cluster in the Azure Preview Portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Creating a new cluster in the Azure Preview Portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a Cluster Name, select Hadoop for the Cluster Type, and from the Cluster Operating System drop-down, select Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter.
trans-unit.target: Enter a Cluster Name, select Hadoop for the Cluster Type, and from the Cluster Operating System drop-down, select Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear beside the cluster name if it is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear beside the cluster name if it is available.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enter cluster name and type</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enter cluster name and type</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have more than one subscription, click the Subscription entry to select the Azure subscription that will be used for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you have more than one subscription, click the Subscription entry to select the Azure subscription that will be used for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click Resource Group to see a list of existing resource groups and then select the one to create the cluster in.
trans-unit.target: Click Resource Group to see a list of existing resource groups and then select the one to create the cluster in.

trans-unit.source: Or, you can click Create New and then enter the name of the new resource group.
trans-unit.target: Or, you can click Create New and then enter the name of the new resource group.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear to indicate if the new group name is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear to indicate if the new group name is available.

trans-unit.source: This entry will default to one of your existing resource groups, if any are available.
trans-unit.target: This entry will default to one of your existing resource groups, if any are available.

trans-unit.source: Click Credentials, then enter a Cluster Login Username and Cluster Login Password.
trans-unit.target: Click Credentials, then enter a Cluster Login Username and Cluster Login Password.

trans-unit.source: If you want to enable remote desktop on the cluster node, for Enable Remote Desktop, click Yes.
trans-unit.target: If you want to enable remote desktop on the cluster node, for Enable Remote Desktop, click Yes.

trans-unit.source: Select a date when remote desktop access to the cluster expires, and provide the username/password for the remote desktop user.
trans-unit.target: Select a date when remote desktop access to the cluster expires, and provide the username/password for the remote desktop user.

trans-unit.source: Click Select at the bottom to save the credentials configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click Select at the bottom to save the credentials configuration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Provide cluster credentials</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Provide cluster credentials</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Data Source to choose an existing data source for the cluster, or create a new one.
trans-unit.target: Click Data Source to choose an existing data source for the cluster, or create a new one.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Data source blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Data source blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Currently you can select an Azure Storage Account as the data source for an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Currently you can select an Azure Storage Account as the data source for an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to understand the entries on the Data Source blade.
trans-unit.target: Use the following to understand the entries on the Data Source blade.

trans-unit.source: Selection Method: Set this to From all subscriptions to enable browsing of storage accounts from all your subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: Selection Method: Set this to From all subscriptions to enable browsing of storage accounts from all your subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Set this to Access Key if you want to enter the Storage Name and Access Key of an existing storage account.
trans-unit.target: Set this to Access Key if you want to enter the Storage Name and Access Key of an existing storage account.

trans-unit.source: Select storage account / Create New: Click Select storage account to browse and select an existing storage account you want to associate with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Select storage account / Create New: Click Select storage account to browse and select an existing storage account you want to associate with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Or, click Create New to create a new storage account.
trans-unit.target: Or, click Create New to create a new storage account.

trans-unit.source: Use the field that appears to enter the name of the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Use the field that appears to enter the name of the storage account.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear if the name is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear if the name is available.

trans-unit.source: Choose Default Container: Use this to enter the name of the default container to use for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Choose Default Container: Use this to enter the name of the default container to use for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: While you can enter any name here, we recommend using the same name as the cluster so that you can easily recognize that the container is used for this specific cluster.
trans-unit.target: While you can enter any name here, we recommend using the same name as the cluster so that you can easily recognize that the container is used for this specific cluster.

trans-unit.source: Location: The geographic region that the storage account is in, or will be created in.
trans-unit.target: Location: The geographic region that the storage account is in, or will be created in.

trans-unit.source: Selecting the location for the default data source will also set the location of the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Selecting the location for the default data source will also set the location of the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The cluster and default data source must be located in the same region.
trans-unit.target: The cluster and default data source must be located in the same region.

trans-unit.source: Click Select to save the data source configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click Select to save the data source configuration.

trans-unit.source: Click Node Pricing Tiers to display information about the nodes that will be created for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click Node Pricing Tiers to display information about the nodes that will be created for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: Set the number of worker nodes that you need for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Set the number of worker nodes that you need for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The estimated cost of the cluster will be shown within the blade.
trans-unit.target: The estimated cost of the cluster will be shown within the blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Node pricing tiers blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Node pricing tiers blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Select to save the node pricing configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click Select to save the node pricing configuration.

trans-unit.source: Click Optional Configuration to select the cluster version, as well as configure other optional settings such as joining a Virtual Network, setting up an External Metastore to hold data for Hive and Oozie, use Script Actions to customize a cluster to install custom components, or use additional storage accounts with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click Optional Configuration to select the cluster version, as well as configure other optional settings such as joining a Virtual Network, setting up an External Metastore to hold data for Hive and Oozie, use Script Actions to customize a cluster to install custom components, or use additional storage accounts with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click the HDInsight Version drop-down and select the version you want to use for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click the HDInsight Version drop-down and select the version you want to use for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>HDInsight cluster versions</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>HDInsight cluster versions</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click Virtual Network to provide configuration details to configure the cluster as part of a virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Click Virtual Network to provide configuration details to configure the cluster as part of a virtual network.

trans-unit.source: In the Virtual Network blade, click Virtual Network and then click a network you want to use.
trans-unit.target: In the Virtual Network blade, click Virtual Network and then click a network you want to use.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, select a Subnet for the network, and then click Select to save the virtual network configuration.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, select a Subnet for the network, and then click Select to save the virtual network configuration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Virtual network blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Virtual network blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click External Metastores to specify SQL database that you want to use to save Hive and Oozie metadata associated with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click External Metastores to specify SQL database that you want to use to save Hive and Oozie metadata associated with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Custom metastores blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Custom metastores blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For Use an existing SQL DB for Hive metadata, click Yes, select a SQL database, and then provide the username/password for the database.
trans-unit.target: For Use an existing SQL DB for Hive metadata, click Yes, select a SQL database, and then provide the username/password for the database.

trans-unit.source: Repeat these steps if you want to Use an existing SQL DB for Oozie metadata.
trans-unit.target: Repeat these steps if you want to Use an existing SQL DB for Oozie metadata.

trans-unit.source: Click Select till you are back on the Optional Configuration blade.
trans-unit.target: Click Select till you are back on the Optional Configuration blade.

trans-unit.source: The Azure SQL database used for the metastore must allow connectivity to other Azure services, including Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: The Azure SQL database used for the metastore must allow connectivity to other Azure services, including Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure SQL database dashboard, on the right side, click the server name.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure SQL database dashboard, on the right side, click the server name.

trans-unit.source: This is the server on which the SQL database instance is running.
trans-unit.target: This is the server on which the SQL database instance is running.

trans-unit.source: Once you are on the server view, click Configure, and then for Azure Services, click Yes, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Once you are on the server view, click Configure, and then for Azure Services, click Yes, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: Click Script Actions if you want to use a custom script to customize a cluster, as the cluster is being created.
trans-unit.target: Click Script Actions if you want to use a custom script to customize a cluster, as the cluster is being created.

trans-unit.source: For more information about script actions, see <link><linkText>Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about script actions, see <link><linkText>Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: On the Script Actions blade provide the details as shown in the screen capture.
trans-unit.target: On the Script Actions blade provide the details as shown in the screen capture.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Script action blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Script action blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Select to save the script action configuration changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Select to save the script action configuration changes.

trans-unit.source: Click Azure Storage Keys to specify additional storage accounts to associate with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click Azure Storage Keys to specify additional storage accounts to associate with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Storage Keys blade, click Add a storage key, and then select an existing storage account or create a new account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Storage Keys blade, click Add a storage key, and then select an existing storage account or create a new account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Additional storage blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Additional storage blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Select till you are back on the New HDInsight cluster blade.
trans-unit.target: Click Select till you are back on the New HDInsight cluster blade.

trans-unit.source: On the New HDInsight Cluster blade, ensure that Pin to Startboard is selected, and then click Create.
trans-unit.target: On the New HDInsight Cluster blade, ensure that Pin to Startboard is selected, and then click Create.

trans-unit.source: This will create the cluster and add a tile for it to the Startboard of your Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: This will create the cluster and add a tile for it to the Startboard of your Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: The icon will indicate that the cluster is provisioning, and will change to display the HDInsight icon once provisioning has completed.
trans-unit.target: The icon will indicate that the cluster is provisioning, and will change to display the HDInsight icon once provisioning has completed.

trans-unit.source: While provisioning
trans-unit.target: While provisioning

trans-unit.source: Provisioning complete
trans-unit.target: Provisioning complete

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Provisioning indicator on startboard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Provisioning indicator on startboard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Provisioned cluster tile</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Provisioned cluster tile</linkText>

trans-unit.source: It will take some time for the cluster to be created, usually around 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: It will take some time for the cluster to be created, usually around 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Use the tile on the Startboard, or the Notifications entry on the left of the page to check on the provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: Use the tile on the Startboard, or the Notifications entry on the left of the page to check on the provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: Once the provisioning completes, click the tile for the cluster from the Startboard to launch the cluster blade.
trans-unit.target: Once the provisioning completes, click the tile for the cluster from the Startboard to launch the cluster blade.

trans-unit.source: The cluster blade provides essential information about the cluser such as the name, the resource group it belongs to, the location, the operating system, URL for the cluster dashboard, etc.
trans-unit.target: The cluster blade provides essential information about the cluser such as the name, the resource group it belongs to, the location, the operating system, URL for the cluster dashboard, etc.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cluster blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cluster blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Use the following to understand the icons at the top of this blade, and in the Essentials and Quick Links section:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to understand the icons at the top of this blade, and in the Essentials and Quick Links section:

trans-unit.source: Settings and All Settings: Displays the Settings blade for the cluster, which allows you to access detailed configuration information for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Settings and All Settings: Displays the Settings blade for the cluster, which allows you to access detailed configuration information for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Dashboard and URL: These are all ways to access the cluster dashboard, which is a Web portal to run jobs on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Dashboard and URL: These are all ways to access the cluster dashboard, which is a Web portal to run jobs on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Remote Desktop: Enables you to enable/disable remote desktop on the cluster nodes.
trans-unit.target: Remote Desktop: Enables you to enable/disable remote desktop on the cluster nodes.

trans-unit.source: Scale Cluster: Allows you to change the number of worker nodes for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: Scale Cluster: Allows you to change the number of worker nodes for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: Delete: Deletes the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Delete: Deletes the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Quickstart (cloud and thunderbolt icon = quickstart): Displays information that will help you get started using HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Quickstart (cloud and thunderbolt icon = quickstart): Displays information that will help you get started using HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Users (users icon): Allows you to set permissions for _portal management_ of this cluster for other users on your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Users (users icon): Allows you to set permissions for _portal management_ of this cluster for other users on your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: This only affects access and permissions to this cluster in the Azure preview portal, and has no effect on who can connect to or submit jobs to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This only affects access and permissions to this cluster in the Azure preview portal, and has no effect on who can connect to or submit jobs to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Tags (tag icon): Tags allows you to set key/value pairs to define a custom taxonomy of your cloud services.
trans-unit.target: Tags (tag icon): Tags allows you to set key/value pairs to define a custom taxonomy of your cloud services.

trans-unit.source: For example, you may create a key named project, and then use a common value for all services associated with a specific project.
trans-unit.target: For example, you may create a key named project, and then use a common value for all services associated with a specific project.

trans-unit.source: Cluster Dashboard: Launches the Cluster Dashboard blade from where you can either launch the cluster dashboard itself, or launch Zeppelin and Jupyter notebooks.
trans-unit.target: Cluster Dashboard: Launches the Cluster Dashboard blade from where you can either launch the cluster dashboard itself, or launch Zeppelin and Jupyter notebooks.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell is a powerful scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell is a powerful scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.

trans-unit.source: This section provides instructions on how to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This section provides instructions on how to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For information on configuring a workstation to run HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see <link><linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information on configuring a workstation to run HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see <link><linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using Azure PowerShell with HDInsight, see <link><linkText>Administer HDInsight using PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on using Azure PowerShell with HDInsight, see <link><linkText>Administer HDInsight using PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For the list of the HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see <link><linkText>HDInsight cmdlet reference</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For the list of the HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see <link><linkText>HDInsight cmdlet reference</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The following procedures are needed to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell:
trans-unit.target: The following procedures are needed to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell:

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure resource group
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure resource group

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Blob container
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Blob container

trans-unit.source: Create an HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Create an HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDI.CLI.Provision</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDI.CLI.Provision</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Using the ARM-based HDInsight .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Using the ARM-based HDInsight .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides .NET client libraries that make it easier to work with HDInsight from a .NET Framework application.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides .NET client libraries that make it easier to work with HDInsight from a .NET Framework application.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions below to create a Visual Studio console application and paste the code for creating a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions below to create a Visual Studio console application and paste the code for creating a cluster.

trans-unit.source: To create a Visual Studio console application
trans-unit.target: To create a Visual Studio console application

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio 2013.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio 2013.

trans-unit.source: From the File menu, click New, and then click Project.
trans-unit.target: From the File menu, click New, and then click Project.

trans-unit.source: From New Project, type or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: From New Project, type or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Category
trans-unit.target: Category

trans-unit.source: Templates/Visual C#/Windows
trans-unit.target: Templates/Visual C#/Windows

trans-unit.source: Template
trans-unit.target: Template

trans-unit.source: Console Application
trans-unit.target: Console Application

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: CreateHDICluster
trans-unit.target: CreateHDICluster

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the project.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to create the project.

trans-unit.source: From the Tools menu, click Nuget Package Manager, and then click Manage Nuget Packages for Solutions.
trans-unit.target: From the Tools menu, click Nuget Package Manager, and then click Manage Nuget Packages for Solutions.

trans-unit.source: In the Search text box within the dialog box, search for HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: In the Search text box within the dialog box, search for HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: From the results that show up, install the following:
trans-unit.target: From the results that show up, install the following:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Azure.Management.HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Azure.Management.HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Azure.Management.HDInsight.Job
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Azure.Management.HDInsight.Job

trans-unit.source: Search for Azure Authentication and from the results that show up, install Microsoft.Azure.Common.Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Search for Azure Authentication and from the results that show up, install Microsoft.Azure.Common.Authentication.

trans-unit.source: From Solution Explorer, double-click Program.cs to open it, paste the following code, and provide values for the variables:
trans-unit.target: From Solution Explorer, double-click Program.cs to open it, paste the following code, and provide values for the variables:

trans-unit.source: Press F5 to run the application.
trans-unit.target: Press F5 to run the application.

trans-unit.source: A console window should open and display the status of the application.
trans-unit.target: A console window should open and display the status of the application.

trans-unit.source: You will also be prompted to enter your Azure account credentials.
trans-unit.target: You will also be prompted to enter your Azure account credentials.

trans-unit.source: It can take several minutes to create an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: It can take several minutes to create an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Next steps
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Next steps

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Perform interactive data analysis using Spark in HDInsight with BI tools</linkText><title></title></link> to learn how to use Apache Spark in HDInsight with BI tools like Power BI and Tableau.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Perform interactive data analysis using Spark in HDInsight with BI tools</linkText><title></title></link> to learn how to use Apache Spark in HDInsight with BI tools like Power BI and Tableau.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Use Spark in HDInsight for building machine learning applications</linkText><title></title></link> to learn how to build machine learning applications using Apache Spark on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Use Spark in HDInsight for building machine learning applications</linkText><title></title></link> to learn how to build machine learning applications using Apache Spark on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Use Spark in HDInsight for building real-time streaming applications</linkText><title></title></link> to learn how to build streaming applications using Apache Spark on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Use Spark in HDInsight for building real-time streaming applications</linkText><title></title></link> to learn how to build streaming applications using Apache Spark on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Manage resources for the Apache Spark cluster in Azure HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link> to learn how to use the Resource Manager to manage resources allocated to the Spark cluster.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Manage resources for the Apache Spark cluster in Azure HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link> to learn how to use the Resource Manager to manage resources allocated to the Spark cluster.
